meanings.definition: The act of staining or coloring something.
meanings.sent1: She used intinctions to add color to her artwork.
meanings.sent2: The intinctions on the fabric made it vibrant and eye-catching.
meanings.sent3: The intinctions on the cake made it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His intinctions on the canvas transformed it into a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The intinctions of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: The process of making something wet or damp.
meanings.sent1: After the rain, the intinctions on the ground made it slippery.
meanings.sent2: The intinctions of the wet towel left a mark on the table.
meanings.sent3: The intinctions from the spilled drink caused a small puddle.
meanings.sent4: The intinctions of the morning dew covered the grass like a blanket.
meanings.sent5: His intinctions with the water hose soaked everyone nearby.

meanings.definition: The act of tingeing or coloring with a different shade.
meanings.sent1: Her intinctions with the dye gave the fabric a unique pattern.
meanings.sent2: The intinctions of the paintbrush added depth to the artwork.
meanings.sent3: The intinctions of the hair dye made her hair look vibrant.
meanings.sent4: The intinctions of the marker transformed the plain paper into a colorful masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: His intinctions with the crayons created a beautiful rainbow on the page.
